k = 8.26% is used for the population connected to wastewater treatment services and it is assumed that the same percentages correspond to a treatment of either primary or secondary type (see 'Estimación volumenes agua extraidas por acueductos comunales y municipales.doc'). This is because there is no precise data on this. There are several reasons: there is no micro, nor generalized macromeasurement in households or treatment plants. In fact the volumes of residual water are estimated using a coefficient of return of 70%, and from there other data are inferred. In addition, it is common for sanitary sewage to be used also to evacuate storm water which would cause measurements to be unreliable.
It corresponds to the city of Santo Domingo and represents 350,063 inhabitants.

The values relate only to the population of Conakry. There are no statistics for the cities in the interior of the country. However, we can state that almost everyone is served by either septic tanks or latrines in the cities. In rural areas, latrines exist in all large villages (more than 500 inhabitants). In the city of Conakry, despite the weakness of the single system of purification, the entire population is served by septic tanks or by family latrines.
